meanings.definition: A Japanese rice cake made of glutinous rice pounded into paste and molded into shape.
meanings.sent1: I tried making mochi with my family during a fun cooking session.
meanings.sent2: In Japan, mochi is often enjoyed during New Year celebrations.
meanings.sent3: The mochi on the plate looked like little snowballs waiting to be eaten.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as soft and sweet as a freshly made mochi.
meanings.sent5: The texture of mochi is like a delightful mix of chewy and smooth.

meanings.definition: A chewy and sweet Japanese dessert made from pounded glutinous rice.
meanings.sent1: My grandma always prepares mochi for special occasions.
meanings.sent2: The mochi at the festival was so colorful and tempting.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally dropped the mochi, and it bounced like a little ball.
meanings.sent4: The sweetness of mochi lingered on my taste buds long after I finished it.
meanings.sent5: Eating mochi feels like enjoying a piece of happiness in every bite.
